Key Arguments: The bill effectively silences misinformation and disinformation on social media platforms, but exempts the government and news outlets from the same standards.
There is concern about who determines what constitutes misinformation and disinformation, as ACMA is given significant power in this regard.
The bill could infringe on freedom of speech, a fundamental right in Australia.
The government has previously disseminated information during the COVID-19 pandemic that the submitter believes was misleading or false.
The bill is seen as undemocratic and unconstitutional, potentially leading to a dictatorship-like control over public discourse.
Notable Quotes: The government are excluding themselves from any requirement to produce and publicise accurate and true information.
Freedom of speech is a fundamental right of every Australian.
If open and honest debate is not permitted, the truth may never be exposed, and those who oppose the official narrative will be treated as criminals.
